subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: The Printer's Mark: Logos Before Mass Media
description: A 60-second lesson on The Printer's Mark: Logos Before Mass Media.

hook.text: In the 1500s, printers carved personal marks into every book they published.

buildup.text: These marks told buyers who printed the book â€” a signal of quality in an unregulated market.

discovery.text: Aldus Manutius used a dolphin and anchor. It became the first widely recognized publisher's logo.

twist.text: Counterfeit printers copied famous marks. Logo piracy was a problem 500 years before knockoff sneakers.

climax.text: Printer's marks established the principle that a symbol can carry the weight of a reputation.

punchline.text: Logo counterfeiting is as old as logos themselves.

quiz.question: What did Aldus Manutius use as his printer's mark?
